p: Available stored clinical specimens from the 180 patients included nasal swabs from 164 (91%), pharyngeal swabs from 157 (88%), lower respiratory tract specimens (bronchial washes, tracheobronchial aspirates, pleural fluids) from 92 (52%), serum or plasma from 26 (14%), and rectal swabs or feces from 25 (14%). Quantitative detection of H5N1 RNA was performed in all 914 available specimens ( Table 1).
